The world is a dangerous place. Enemies are growing stronger and stronger with each passing day.
Enemies receive bonus level depending on how many days have passed.

Set a target class for this Adventurer.
If an adventurer has a target class the game will only notify you about an available class change if the Adventurer can change to the target class.
Gets reset during a class change.
Pay a bonus to improve mood. Can stack.

A Party with a leader will have an additional 5% chance to trigger a chain attack. Additionally, all Party members gain a bonus on their bravery depending on the leader's willpower. A character will lose mood if they lose their position as leader.
This setting will automatically resize and center custom portraits to always fit the frames they're used in. This will look best for most custom portraits.

You'll find an .ini file in C:\Users[username]\AppData\LocalLow\TheGreenGuy that allows you to modify certain values in the game.
<color=#FF6969>BACK UP YOUR SAVES BEFORE USING IT!</color>
How many auto saves the game will manage. Does not apply for Ironman.
You'll be able to create completely custom characters in the tavern for a fee with a point system.
Adventurers will not be able to level beyond the maximal allowed level dictated by the current Rank of the Guild.
The hit chance will no longer be restricted between 5% and 95%.
All Quests will have the <color=orange>{NON_LETHAL}</color>-Modifier. Adventurers can not die on quests but will still be gone from the Quest when they fail their Death Resist check.
Attribute gains will no longer be rolled. Attributes will statically increase according to their growth.
Enemies will gain bonus level depending on how many days have passed. (Changing the settings here will not have any effects on enemies who have already spawned on the Questmap.)
The day from which the enemy will start scaling.
How many days need to pass each time starting from the start day until enemies will gain a bonus level.
A bonus multiplier that will apply on Physical Attack Bonus and Magical Attack Bonus of enemies.
A bonus multiplier that will apply on hitpoints of enemies.
A flat bonus to enemy accuracy.
A flat bonus to adventurer accuracy.
A bonus multiplier that will apply on the gold and item rewards of Quests. Item rewards for story quests are unaffected.
A bonus multiplier to the total value of items that can be found in chests or resource nodes.
A bonus multiplier on the amount of experience points adventurers gain from defeating enemies.
A bonus multiplier for the experience points reward for quests.
A bonus multiplier on how many points will be used to generate random encounters.(Will not change encounters that are already roaming on the map.)
Donate to receive a random blessing for the next quest.
The success chance of the assignment. It can be increased by assigning adventurers with relevant stats.
The likelihood of the assigned characters getting injured during the assignment. The injury chance will be rolled for every character individually.
How the mood of the adventurers will be changed after completing the assignment.

Party gains the following stats during Battle:
+5 Initiative
If the corresponding Guild Upgrade is unlocked, the party can learn low-tier Teamwork Skills. If the synergy level is lower than this, acquired low-tier Teamwork skills will become inactive.
If the corresponding Guild Upgrade is unlocked, the party can learn mid-tier Teamwork Skills. If the synergy level is lower than this, acquired mid-tier Teamwork skills will become inactive.
If the corresponding Guild Upgrade is unlocked, the party can learn high-tier Teamwork Skills. If the synergy level is lower than this, acquired high-tier Teamwork skills will become inactive.
The total amount of time the adventurers will need to complete the assignment.

How well the Party works together. Their Synergy depend on their relationship to each other and how many times they have gone on a quest together as a Party.

Currrent Synergy:
{RELATION_SYNERGY} points from their Relationship
{EXPERIENCE_SYNERGY} points from doing Quests together{LEADER_SYNERGY}
Multiplier to the Exp. Reward upon completing the Quest. Increases when defeating enemies.
The likelyhood of the party getting ambushed during their rest.

Your current Stamina is displayed here. It's determined by the cumulative sum of the endurance stats of your adventurers. If it reaches zero, your adventurers will become exhausted. In this state, enemies move at double speed on the map, and adventurers start battle encounters with 1 less AP. Stamina can be replenished by camping.
Only a single savefile and no manual saving.
Is the Summoner of the unit.
A save file with the same name already exists. Do you want to overwrite it?

Dear friend, It has been a long time, hasn't it? I always thought about writing to you but I've never found the courage to do so. How ironic that my very first letter to you would also be my last. Because by the time you receive this letter, I will already be dead. Friend, I have a favor I want to ask of you. It concerns the Adventurer Guild. It has been...difficult these last couple of years. It shames me to admit that we have been struggling and I'm afraid of what will become of the Guild, now that I'm gone. I fear that without the right leadership it will cease to exist. That's why I want you to become the new Guild Master. I know it might be selfish of me to ask this of you but I ask you as your friend. As someone who considered you family... Please don't let our dream die. Former Guild Master of the Adventurer Guild and your old friend Fran
You're about to leave loot behind. Are you sure?
You failed the check. Are you sure you want to accept the result?

<color=#2aa136>Easy Difficulty</color>: 
A more forgiving experience. Enemies have 20% less hitpoints, physical and magical attack.

Normal Difficulty(Recommended): 
For players who are familiar with tactical games. No difficulty modifiers.

<color=#a12a2a>Hard Difficulty</color>: 
Be prepared to lose adventurers. Enemies have 20% more hitpoints, physical and magical attack and 10 more accuracy. Quest rewards are reduced by 10%. Loot is reduced by 20%.

<color=#a12a2a>Very Hard Difficulty</color>: 
You've asked for it! Enemies have 30% more hitpoints, physical and magical attack and 20 more accuracy. Quest rewards are reduced by 20%. Loot is reduced by 30%.

A flat bonus to the {HEAL_EMPOWEREMENT} of the adventurers. It affects healing and regeneration.
A flat bonus to the {HEAL_EMPOWEREMENT} of the enemies. It affects healing and regeneration.

The seal has been weakened. The Battle gains the Effect <color=orange>Holy Support</color>.
The save has Ironman enabled. Do you still want to keep it enabled?
You will skip the Tutorial Quest and certain some dialogues. Additionally, you will receive no tutorial messages during your playthrough.
Master Classes no longer require a specific trait.
Keep all the proposals you've already unlocked.
The likelihood of surviving a deathblow is {AMOUNT}% less.
All adventurers you take with you will start at level 1. They'll lose all the skills they've learned and all their attributes will be set to 5. They'll start with a single skill point.
Lephoz with physical skills gain <color=orange>{SNEAKATTACK}</color> at level 6.
Bandits will still spawn with demonic marks even after the Bandit King is defeated.
Jotuns also have access to demonic marks.
Hobgoblins also have access to demonic marks.
Vampires, Ghosts and Wraiths also have regeneration.
All enemies gain +20 Resistance against Fire, Earth, Lightning, Ice, Holy and Dark Damage.
Boss-Enemies gain an additional turn per round.
Most boss fights will also have an additional elite.
Some Boss-Enemies will gain additional skills

In battles that would end with the boss being eliminated, the boss gains an ability that reduces the damage taken by 10% (up to 50%) for each ally. This does not apply to battles with endless reinforcements.
For each New Game Plus Run enemies will gain +10% HP and +10% Physical/Magical Damage. You will also gain 100 points for each run.

Select the adventurers you like to keep. They will retain their levels and their traits.
Adding adventurers will cost you 40 points for each one.

Select the items you like to keep.
Divine Items cost 40 points, Legendary 30,  Epic 20, Rare 10, Uncommon 5 and Common are free.
The percentage of the max. hit points an adventurer has to lose during a Quest before they are considered injured.
A modifier for the difficulty of Attribute Checks.
Only show who can gain titles
There will also be several interactable objects on the Quest Map, highlighted with a sparkle effect. To interact with them, get next to them and press the A-Button.
